description.narrative: By end ot 2017, the knowledge foundation (gap analysis, costs, etc.) is in place for the effective implementation of the Children's Protection and Welfare Act 2011 (CPWA)

sector.narrative: Country programme process (including UNDAF planning and CCA)
ECD data, evidence, and knowledge generation and dissemination
Harmful practices - planning, co-ordination and programme monitoring
Inter-sectoral coordination and collaboration on violence, exploitation and abuse
Services to prevent or respond to violence, exploitation and abuse
Social protection and welfare services policy, planning and administration
Technical assistance - Prevention and response services for violence against children
Violence, exploitation, and abuse - surveys (e.g. KAP, VACS), data analysis/research/evaluation evidence generation, synthesis, and use

description.narrative: Social Protection, Land Housing and Community Amenities policy, planning and administration
Social Protection, Land Housing and Community Amenities social services (incl youth development and women+ children)

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

description.narrative: There has been a slow progress in strengthening the referral mechanisms and standard operating procedures in order to facilitate effective referrals of children in need of protection services. | Status:Constrained | As-of Date:29/07/2018

title.narrative: # of institutions used child protection and Justice for children (J4C) Module
